creditline: Gift of Raymond and Gladys Karhu for Clifton Karhu
description: standing, barefoot man looking up and pointing a bow straight up; arrow falling down toward man's head
inscription:
Japanese proverb:
Heta na teppo_ mo kazu uteba ataru
IF/YOU/SHOOT/ENOUGH/ARROWS/YOU/MIGHT/HIT/SOMETHING

Original meaning is \"If you shoot a gun frequently enough, you might hit the target some day.\"
markings: 2 seals in red, prorbably artist\'s seals
title: Untitled [arrows]
